Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the playing board which will hold a 2D array of space objects.
    Version:
    6/5
    Author:
    Darren and Sushane

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Default constructor which creates an 8x8 board with various obstacles optimized for a "fair" game, inspired by some boards from google images.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] findLoc(int val)
      Accesses a certain value on the board by returning an array by sequential search.
      int findObstacle(int value)
      Checks if a certain space's value contians an obstacle.
      Space[][] getBoard()
      Accesses the board, represented by a 2D array.
      Space getSpace(int loc1, int loc2)
      Accesses a certain location on the board.
      void printBoard()
      Prints out the board, as it will appear in game, similar to the matrix view of a 2D array.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Default constructor which creates an 8x8 board with various obstacles optimized for a "fair" game, inspired by some boards from google images.

    • Method Detail

      • findLoc

        public int[] findLoc(int val)
        Accesses a certain value on the board by returning an array by sequential search.
        Parameters:
        An - integer, which represents the value that is being searched for
        Returns:
        A 1D array, where the first index represents the row and the second index represents the columns.

      • findObstacle

        public int findObstacle(int value)
        Checks if a certain space's value contians an obstacle.
        Parameters:
        An - integer which represents the value.
        Returns:
        An integer which represents the obstacle's end value.

      • getBoard

        public Space[][] getBoard()
        Accesses the board, represented by a 2D array.
        Returns:
        A reference to the board.

      • getSpace

        public Space getSpace(int loc1,
                      int loc2)
        Accesses a certain location on the board.
        Parameters:
        Two - integers which represent the row and column at which the desired space is located at.
        Returns:
        A reference to the space object which is at the location specified.

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints out the board, as it will appear in game, similar to the matrix view of a 2D array. Used for testing purposes.
